UrlGet

This component is used to retrieve files or data from a server using a get or post method. The Local Path parameter specifies the path on the host device to save the data to, unless the Boolean parameter, Use URL Path, is set to 1 in which case the URL is used to construct the path on the host device to save the data to. The Path Levels to Remove parameter is used in combination with the Use URL Path parameter to specify which elements of the URL to ignore when using it to construct the path to save the data to. If no Local Path is specified and the Use URL Path parameter is "0" then the data is presented to the output [Out]Response. These parameters can be overridden by using the data inputs [In]local path and [In]URLdirDump.

Post requests to the server can be included in the URL presented to the data input [In]URL or by presenting the key value pairs separated by the "&" character to the data input [In]post data. Escape characters for special characters such as spaces and brackets are added for you and need not be included in the post string if it is presented to the data input [In]post data.

Both the get and post methods trigger the output event [In]Getting when the input event [In]Get fires. If the requested is successfully processed by the server then the output event [Out]Data Ready is triggered. If the request was unsuccessful or timed out after a time specified by the Timeout parameter then the output event [Out]Error is triggered and a standard HTTP error code and error message are presented to the data outputs [Out]enum and [Out]estring respectively.

A priority can be assigned to the request by specifying a value in the Priority parameter. The priority can range from 0 to -100 where 0 indicates the highest priority and will continue to request data from the server until the request has been satisfied and a priority of -100 will reduce the frequency of those requests to give priority to other server traffic. The implementation of prioritisation is platform specific. The Priority parameter can be overridden using the data input [In]Priority.

Ports

  • [In] Get:

    Input event, makes a request to the server.

  • [Out] Getting:

    Output event, triggered by the input event [In]Get.

  • [In] Abort:

    Input event, aborts the request to the server.

  • [Out] ------------:

    Output event.

  • [In] URL:

    Data input, the URL to request data from.

  • [In] post data:

    Data input, post data to be included in the request to the server.

  • [In] local path:

    Data input, the path in the host device to save the data to.

  • [In] URLdirDump:

    Data input, the number of levels of the URL to remove when constructing a path to save the data to.

  • [In] Priority:

    Data input, the priority level of the request.

  • [Out] Response:

    Data output, the data returned by the server if not saved to disk.

  • [Out] DataReady:

    Output event, triggered when the data has been successfully retrieved.

  • [Out] Error:

    Output event, triggered when the request has been unsuccessfully or has timed out.

  • [Out] enum:

    Data output, the standard HTTP error code presented when the output event [In]Error fires.

  • [Out] estring:

    Data output, the standard HTTP error message presented when the output event [In]Error fires.

Parameters

  • URL:

    The URL for the get or post methods.

    Data Type:

    S,

    Min Value:

    "",

    Max Value:

    None,

    Default Value:

    None

  • Post Data:

    The key value pairs for the post request.

    Data Type:

    S,

    Min Value:

    "",

    Max Value:

    None,

    Default Value:

    None

  • Local Path:

    Local path on the host device to save the data

    Data Type:

    S,

    Min Value:

    "",

    Max Value:

    None,

    Default Value:

    None

  • Use URL Path:

    Flag to indicate whether URL should be used to construct the path to save the data to instead of Local Path.

    Data Type:

    B,

    Min Value:

    0,

    Max Value:

    1,

    Default Value:

    1

  • Path Levels to Remove (N):

    If Use URL path is set to "1" then this parameter specfies how many path levels to remove from the beginning of the path, when constructing the path to save the data to.

    Data Type:

    I,

    Min Value:

    0,

    Max Value:

    10000,

    Default Value:

    0

  • Priority:

    The priority to be assigned to the request where a priority of "0" is the same as any other function and a priority of "-100" is the lowest relative priority.

    Data Type:

    I,

    Min Value:

    -100,

    Max Value:

    0,

    Default Value:

    0

  • Timeout:

    Times out the initial HTTP request and returns an Error output event and HTTP error code if no connection is made.

    Data Type:

    I,

    Min Value:

    -1,

    Max Value:

    3600,

    Default Value:

    60

State Machine

Stateless.

Profiles

All.

Toolbox

Core.

Version

v2.1.

Native Dependencies

  • TDK1.1:

Licence Type

LGPL.

Component Supplier

inx ltd.
